resources.string: Run This Command from Your PC
Customize appearance of the navigation pill
Wondering how to use the app? We\'re here to help.
If you have some feedback, we\'d love to hear it!
Have a question about the app? Visit the XDA thread and ask away.
XDA has other apps too. Check them out!
Unlock more functionality with the premium add-on.
adb shell pm grant com.xda.nobar android.permission.WRITE_SECURE_SETTINGS
Hi. I\'m just here to make sure the app isn\'t killed by the system. Feel free to hide me.
When activated, the pill will become invisible in landscape. Tap once where it is normally located to have it show, then perform your gesture.
When activated, the pill will disappear on the home screen.
Prevent the pill from moving above the keyboard.
Certain devices show the original navigation bar on the side in landscape. Activate this to prevent that behavior.
Many tablets force the navigation bar to always be on the bottom of the screen. Turn this on to account for that behavior.
Use root to perform actions instead of the Accessibility Service.
This app brings awesome navigation gestures to any Android device. Best of all, it doesn\’t need root! Before you can use the gestures, there are a few things we have to do to set the app up.

In order for Navigation Gestures to show the pill-nav, you will need to grant permission for it to draw over other apps. Tap the button below to do so. If you installed from the Play Store, this permission will already be granted.
This app uses an Accessibility Service to simulate the original navigation buttons. Click \“Grant\” below to enable access.
We can completely hide your stock navigation bar, but we need access to a special permission to do so. Click the button below to learn how you can grant it. If you are rooted, accept the root prompt.

You\’re ready to use navigation gestures on your device. You can toggle the pill-nav on the following page or from a Quick Settings tile that we have provided. For your convenience, we have enabled some gestures that we think you might like. You can customize these in the Settings.
You\’re ready to use navigation gestures on your device.

Don\'t worry. You can still use this app. Root actually makes the setup easier. If you like, we can use root access to grant this permission automatically. Otherwise, you can choose to use the tutorial/manual method.
Looks like one or more permissions got revoked somehow. No worries, though. We\'ll help get you back up and running.
This action requires the premium add-on. Would you like to purchase it?
This action requires a device running Android Nougat or later. Sorry about that.

Android Nougat allows for custom quick settings tiles, and we\'ve included one to toggle Navigation Gestures. You can add it by swiping down twice from the status bar, tapping the pencil icon or \"EDIT\" and dragging Navigation Gestures\' tile into the active area.

This app uses an Accessibility Service to simulate navigation button presses like the back, home, and multitasking buttons. We do not use it to collect any personal information, and no action will be performed except by the user.
Because your device is running Android P, this app will not currently work.
If you decide to uninstall Navigation Gestures, disable it before doing so! We are unable to detect an app uninstall, so we cannot revert changes automatically.
Using this app you may notice a small white bar at the very bottom of the display. This is not a bug! It is required to prevent much more serious issues.
While using this app, if you notice that the original navigation bar is present when it shouldn\'t be, head over to Settings>>Other and try the compatibility options there.
Hmm. It seems this permission wasn\'t granted. Make sure to follow all instructions, and try again.
Pill hidden. Tap or swipe up to reshow.
